intro: Sida lanceolata, commonly known as narrowleaf sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has alternate, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Sida lanceolata is known for its fibrous stems and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. It thrives in disturbed soils and is commonly found in fields and along roadsides.
